001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.persistence.segment;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.PersistencePort;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessagePair;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
007import java.nio.file.Files;
008import java.nio.file.Path;
009
010/**
011 * Simple NDJSON sink for message pairs used during migration from legacy tooling.
012 * <p>Writes each pair to {@code pairs.ndjson}, overwriting the previous contents.</p>
013 *
014 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
015 */
016public final class SegmentSinkAdapter implements PersistencePort {
017  private final Path directory;
018
019  /**
020   * Creates an adapter that writes under the supplied directory.
021   *
022   * @param directory target directory (created as needed)
023   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code directory} is {@code null}
024   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
025   */
026  public SegmentSinkAdapter(Path directory) {
027    this.directory = directory;
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * Serializes the pair as a minimal JSON object and writes it to {@code pairs.ndjson}.
032   *
033   * @param pair message pair to persist; {@code null} is ignored
034   * @throws IOException if the file cannot be written
035   * @implNote Overwrites the file on each invocation; only suitable for debugging.
036   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
037   */
038  @Override
039  public void persist(MessagePair pair) throws IOException {
040    if (pair == null) return;
041    Files.createDirectories(directory);
042    Path target = directory.resolve("pairs.ndjson");
043    Files.writeString(target, serialize(pair) + "\n", StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
044  }
045
046  private static String serialize(MessagePair pair) {
047    return "{" + "\"protocol\":\"" + pair.request().protocol() + "\"}";
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * Closes the sink. No-op for this adapter.
052   *
053   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
054   */
055  @Override
056  public void close() throws Exception {}
057}
